instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Hey, first it came in no power, no sign of h20 or burn, i looked and 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0.3v and find problem with speaker amp. now i got 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> = 11.5V

seems like pp5vg3s got some problem, where to look and what next

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on the T2 lines connected to that chip.
Like <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL>, etc...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> diode mode to g 0.007v
<SIGNAL>SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL> diode mode to g 0.032v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
So T2 internal damage.
Classic problem, when found corrosion underneath speaker amps; <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> connected there too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Now i got 5v and 300mah but no 20v
